**API documentation for Wassenger**



> ğŸ”¥ ğŸ†• [**Introducing Flows**: No-Code Automation Solution to create AI agents and automate anything on WhatsApp! Learn more](/flows)



## Introduction



This API documentation provides detailed information about the API endpoints and request/response API contracts.



You can easily browse all the API resources, request/response the with code examples in 15+ programming languages, including JavaScript/Node.js, Python, PHP, Ruby, Java, C#, Go, Swift, Kotlin, ObjectiveC, C/C++, cURL, Powershell and more.



This is a web based API, therefore is only required to send HTTPS requests in order to communicate with the API, making it very easy to use and integrate with any third-party software, programming language, CMS, CRM or CLI tools.



The API does not require any SDK and has no strict software dependencies, it can be easily used with no friction by simply sending HTTPS requests to the desired API endpoint.



> ğŸ¤© ğŸ¤– **[New! Ask the Wassenger AI Assistant to write code for you](https://chatgpt.com/g/g-67db491dda308191aaccae50434c3f39-wassenger)** ğŸ‘‰



## Security



This API is intended for use exclusively in server-side applications.

Attempting to use them in a client-side application will result in Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) errors. This restriction is intentional and ensures the security and integrity of the service.

## Model Context Protocol (MCP) ğŸ†•



MCP (acronym of [Model Context Protocol](https://modelcontextprotocol.io/)) connector lets you connect your {{account.name}} WhatsApp numbers into modern AI LLMs and chat with your WhatsApp data, analyze conversation, send messages, or perform any other WhatsApp action directly from your favorite AI chat or code tool.



- ğŸ¤– **[Learn how to use MCP with your AI tool](/help/mcp)**

status.description: HTTP status code of the error. Same as HTTP protocol response status

errorCode.description: Application specific error code. Not always present.

errors.description: Additional data validation errors, if present

user.description: User owner ID of the file

permission.description: Optional file access permission. Defaults to `public`: all team members can access, download and send the file. If set to `private` only the file owner can access, download and send the file.

format.description: Media native presentation format allowed by WhatsApp. Defaults to native media format (audio, video or document). If you want to send videos as gifs, use format = "gif".  If you want to send audio messages like they were sent as voice records as PTT or Push To Talk, then use format = "ptt".

url.description: File origin remote URL, if provided

contact.description: Optional contact WhatsApp WID to which the file is linked to

expiresAt.description: File expiration date. The file will be no longer available once expired. You can also define a longer expiration date or re-upload the file.

reference.description: User defined file reference value for custom traceability

filename.description: File name defined by the user or inferred

mime.description: File MIME type inferred at upload time

message.description: File optional message to be used as message caption when delivery

width.description: Media width size, when available in images and video files

height.description: Media height size, when available in images and video files

duration.description: Media duration in seconds, when available in video and audio files

codec.description: Media format codec name, when available in video and audio files

width.description: Media width size, when available in images and video files

height.description: Media height size, when available in images and video files

size.description: Media preview image file size in bytes

image.description: Media preview image content in Base64 encoding, when available in images and video files

downloads.description: Total number of file downloads via message delivery or API download requests

deliveries.description: Total number of file delivery attempts by sending it as attached media

active.description: Enable or disable custom working hours per weekday

createdAt.description: Agent addition date to the device

retentionPolicy.description: Data retention policy applied to device's storage in the system, including inbound/outbound messages and chats. A custom data retention policy can be used to automatically delete messages once they are processed or after a specific amount ot time (e.g: 1 hour or 1 day). Once the maximum retention is exceeded, message data will not be accessible from the Web Console or API anymore. If you take want to keep track of data, we recommend you to query the messages via API and store them in your own system.

rebootPolicy.description: Optionally enable automatic session reboot policy for the current device in a specific interval. This might help you to avoid performance or memory issues in long running sessions, which is especially helpful in Platform devices where the session is tipically running for long hours or days. The system will automatically reboot your device session without having to re-authorize it every time or requiring any manual intervention. Reboot will cause up to 2 minutes downtime and message processing delay, but no messages will be lost during the process.

deliverySpeed.description: Maximum messages delivery speed per minute for the current device. Maximum plan delivery speed limit applies here. Use "0" for default plan delivery speed or define a custom allowed value for custom delivery speed control.

exceptUser.description: Last user that set the operating hours exception

screenLock.description: Whether the device screen lock is enabled or not

chatLock.description: Whether the chats lock protection password is active on this number

contacts.description: Total number of user contacts in the WhatsApp number, whether they are in the mobile agenda or not

contactsAgenda.description: Total number of user contacts in the mobile agenda

device.description: Device to which the current message is associated with

reference.description: User defined message reference text-free value

phone.description: Target message mobile phone number in international format (E164). Example: `+1234567890`

group.description: Target group chat WhatsApp ID to send message to. Examples: `123456789000000000` or `123456789000000000@g.us`

channel.description: Target channel chat WhatsApp ID to send message to. Examples: `123000098765421000` or `123000098765421000@newsletter`

chat.description: Target chat WhatsApp ID the message is delivered to. Examples: `1234567890@c.us` for user chats, `123456789000000000@g.us` for group chats and `9582938293912@lid` for private chats

quote.description: Message ID to be quoted within the same chat, if available

typing.description: Optional. Simulate typing / recording status on the target chat in seconds

selectId.description:
Reply to buttons or list messages by selecting one of the available elements by its unique ID. 
**Important**: requires the `quote` field to be present referring to the original buttons or list message ID to be replied to.

call.description: Event call type: `voice` or `video`, `null` for no call

date.description: Event start date and time, from now up to 1 year

link.description: Event meeting link. Empty by default, randomly generated at message delivery time

event.description: Event message ID to attend to (18, 20, 22, 24 or 32 hexademical characters length)

confirm.description: Confirm attendance to event (true) or reject it (false)

multiple.description: Poll allows multiple options to be selected

poll.description: Poll message ID to vote for

request.description: Send a location request interactive message to obtain the user location

address.description: Location full address compatible with Google Maps

name.description: Location user-defined or georeversed optional name rendered as location message type

file.description: File media object. Seexx Files entity API endpoints for more information about files.

filename.description: Optional media file name, if available.

kind.description: Media file type: image, video, audio or document

format.description: Media native presentation format allowed by WhatsApp. Defaults to native media format (audio, video or document). If you want to send videos as gifs, use format = "gif" (only compatible with "video/mp4" file type).  If you want to send audio messages like they were sent as voice records as PTT or Push To Talk, then use format = "ptt" (only compatible with "audio/ogg" file type).

viewOnce.description: Optional, only applicable to images and videos. If `viewMode` is `true`, the media content will disappear on WhatsApp after the recipient has opened it and exited the media viewer.

sendReadAck.description:
Send messages read acknowledgement right after the message gets delivered, simulating user native behavior after opening a chat with pending unread messages.

Use "true" in order to report to the target user/group members that received messages were readed by you with blue double-check.

Note: in case you have disabled read confirmation in WhatsApp Settings > Account > Privacy, this configuration will have no effect.

retries.description: Number of notification retries in a row

lastRetryAt.description: Last retry attempt date, if available

device.description: If present, webhook events are restricted to the specific device. Optional

objectId.description: Notification event object ID, if available. This ID is used as the unique idempotency key.

deviceId.description: Notification event device ID, if available.

objectType.description: Notification event object type, if available.

objectEvent.description: Notification event code name used for the notification. This determines the type of webhook notification, such as: message:in:new.

message.description: Message data or error message, if available

body.description: HTTP request body. Only available in certain events

clone.description: If the campaign was cloned, this field will contain the source campaign ID

mode.description: Campaign message delivery mode. `single` for the same message to many contacts or `multiple` for many messages to each contact

source.description: Campaign recipients source. `import` for the file imported recipients  via Excel/CSV/Google Sheets, or `contacts` for CRM loaded contacts source.

file.description: Optional image or video media file to send

wid.description: WhatsApp chat ID. This ID is taken from WhatsApp and represents the unique ID of the chat within the WhatsApp number.

lid.description: WhatsApp private chat ID: optional hidden number ID protected by WhatsApp due to enhanced privacy

status.description: Platform internal chat status. This status is different from the WhatsApp-specific app status (active, archived, removed).

waStatus.description: WhatsApp chat app internal status. This value may be different from the `status` field that represents the platform-level status of the chat (resolved, pending, active, removed...).

statusUpdatedAt.description: Last date-time the chat status was changed. E.g: (pending to resolved, resolved to pending, pending to removed...)

statusUpdatedBy.description: Last user agent ID who changed the chat status

agent.description: User that is currently assigned to the chat

autoAssignDepartment.description: When applicable, department to which the chat was auto-assigned to

expiresAt.description: Free messaging open chat window expiration date-time. Only applicable to WABA numbers.

firstMessageAt.description: First message date on this chat

lastMessageAt.description: Latest message date on this chat

isLocked.description: Whether this chat is password locked on the WhatsApp app

agent.description: Agent message owner ID, if available

reference.description: Optional message reference user-defined value token or identifier

editedAt.description: Date of message edit, if applicable

sourceUrl.description: Original referral source URL (e.g. ad link)

headerFile.description: Optional message header WABA file ID

source.description: Defines the message source sent from different WhatsApp client origins.

via.description: Only available for `outbound` messages. Defines the sender origin for the current message: `app` for messages sent from the mobile app, `platform` for messages sent from the platform-linked session, and `remote` for messages sent from other linked devices.

isFirstMessage.description: **Field only available in webhook event payloads**. Defines if the current message was the first message sent for outbound messages or received for inbound messages in the specific chat context.

color.description: Color used in the user status message. Only applicable to user status updates, not to chat messages

font.description: Font style used in the user status message. Only applicable to user status updates, not to chat messages

apiKey.name: Token
apiKey.description:
User API key token needs to be used on every API request that requires authentication.



You can define it via "token" URL query param or via "Token" HTTP request header.



Get or create your API key from the [Web Console](https://console.wassenger.com/apikeys).



**Note**: chat agents and supervisors have no access to the API.



#### Example as request header:

```

GET /v1/messages HTTP/1.1

Host: api.wassenger.com:443

Token: 5f2296349b12abf18c3e4a072cfceb47f51bde312477d048a0baf7cccf4af17861e28f80739d3a3f

```

#### Example as URL query param:

```

GET /v1/messages?token=5f2296349b12abf18c3e4a072cfceb47f51bde312477d048a0baf7cccf4af17861e28f80739d3a3f HTTP/1.1

Host: api.wassenger.com:443

```

import requests

url = "https://api.wassenger.com/v1/webhooks"

# List all account webhooks
require 'uri'
require 'net/http'

url = URI("https://api.wassenger.com/v1/webhooks")

http.use_ssl = true

puts response.read_body

// List all account webhooks
package main

import (
	"fmt"
	"net/http"
	"io"
)

func main() {

	url := "https://api.wassenger.com/v1/webhooks"

	req, _ := http.NewRequest("GET", url, nil)

	req.Header.Add("Token", "<api token goes here>")

	res, _ := http.DefaultClient.Do(req)

	defer res.Body.Close()
	body, _ := io.ReadAll(res.Body)

	fmt.Println(res)
	fmt.Println(string(body))

}

post.description:
Register new webhook endpoint URL for callback notifications.

**For more information about Webhooks use cases and integration examples, [read the Webhook Tutorial here](/help/webhooks)**.

If you do not know what webhooks are, [read this article](https://codeburst.io/what-are-webhooks-b04ec2bf9ca2).

**Note**: webhook endpoint URL must be reachable at public Internet level
and use a valid domain with proper DNS resolution. E.g: https://mycompany.com/webhook

Our system will make an [HTTP request](https://www.tutorialspoint.com/http/http_requests.htm)
to the remote endpoint URL you provide every time a new message/device event happens.

Information will be encoded in [JSON](https://www.json.org/) format as part of the HTTP body data.

Your server must accept read the body in the HTTP POST request and process it accodingly.

You server should reply with a 200-209 HTTP status code. Otherwise, it will be considered as a
failed notification and it will be retried.

### Questions

Read the common questions and answers in [this Help Center article](/help/webhooks#questions).

### Security advice

We strongly recommend to use HTTPS instead of HTTP since communication would be end-to-end encrypted.

### Webhook events

Supported webhook events are:

- **message:in:new**: On every new incoming message sent by users or groups to your device (restricted to Platform plans)
- **message:out:new**: On every outbound message delivered from the connected WhatsApp number to other users (restricted to Platform plans)
- **message:out:sent**: On every successfully delivered message (restricted to Gateway plans)
- **message:out:ack**: On every outbound message status update: received or read by the user (restricted to Platform Business and Enterprise plans)
- **message:update**: Notify when an existing message content is updated: on new poll votes, on event attendance confirmation or cancelation, on message edit
- **message:reaction**: Notify when a message reaction is added or removed. Only supported in the Business and Enterprise plans
- **status:update**: On every new user status story publication made by any your saved contacts
- **channel:in**: On every newly received message on any channel you are following
- **message:out:failed**: On every failed message delivery (max retries exceeded, invalid media or phone number not found)
- **number:session**: Notified when the number WhatsApp session goes online, offline or disconnects
- **group:update**: On every group update: new group, name change, subject change, participant added or removed, participant promoted or demoted, group settings change
- **chat:update**: On every chat update: chat status changes, chat is assigned or unassigned, chat is resolved or unresolved, chat is archived, chat is removed
- **contact:update**: On every contact update: information or metadata is updated

Find below more details and JSON examples for the different webhook events.

### Webhook examples

Explore dozens of webhook events JSON payload examples and real use cases in [the Help Center article](/help/webhooks#examples).

#### New inbound message event

**Event**: `message:in:new`

Note: this event type is only available in Platform plans. Find below for Gateway plans specific webhook events.

**Example of new inbound text message webhook event (JSON payload)**

#### Message sent event (Gateway plans only)

**Important**: the following webhooks events are only available in Gateway plans and are deprecated in other plans.

If you are using a different plan, use the following webhook event instead:

- Use `message:out:new` instead of `message:out:sent`

This event uses a JSON payload data that is structured as an array of objects, thus multiple messages can be notified in the same HTTP POST request, up to 25 items per notification.
